column11: Review Text

Ambuluwawa Tower is truly unique and offers breathtaking views of the Sri Lankan landscape. The climb itself is quite an adventure, with narrow pathways that make the journey exciting and memorable. Once at the top, the panoramic scenery is absolutely worth the effort and makes for stunning photos. However, be prepared for a crowd, especially near the final section of the climb. There was a significant wait to access the last part of the tower, and after some time in the sun, I chose not to continue. To enjoy the experience comfortably, I would recommend visiting early in the morning or during quieter hours. Overall, Ambuluwawa Tower is a must-see for travelers looking for an adventurous and scenic stop in Sri Lanka. It‚Äôs a one-of-a-kind attraction that combines culture, nature, and a little bit of thrill!

We took an Uber here from kandy and the tuk tuk mafia made us get out and take their rip off 2000LKR per person trip up. The uber got up fine with 2 people in car and I think 4 of us would be fine! The tower is fun with great views. But a high entry fee if LKR2000. Be careful Sri Lanka - treat tourists liken cash cows, and we won‚Äôt come‚Ä¶
One of the most unique towers I have ever seen - and climbed. And the views are absolutely stunning! Taking a tuk tuk up the hill is an experience in itself.

Do not be dizzy (we did not climb the last steps because the stairs are narrow and not secure in case of crossing) but the place is picturesque, untouristy (but locals), and the view at 369* on the area is beautiful. Better ride a tuktuk from the parking lot to the tower!
Travel with Dimma Travel with Dimma to Ambuluwawa tower to feel the Srilankan uniq Vibrance and feel like Wow.Visit Srillanka.This is best time

üèîÔ∏è What is Ambuluwawa Tower? Ambuluwawa Tower is a unique multi-religious tower and ecological site located near Gampola, in the Central Province of Sri Lanka. It sits atop Ambuluwawa Mountain, which is about 1,087 meters (3,567 ft) above sea level

I recently visited Ambuluwawa Tower in Gampola with my friends, and it turned out to be one of the most unforgettable experiences of my life. At first, the journey felt easy ‚Äì just like life in the beginning, when many people walk with you. But as we climbed higher, the path became narrow and challenging. I noticed something beautiful and deep: the higher you go, the fewer people can walk with you. Near the top, only one person can go at a time, just like in life ‚Äì your journey, your dreams, and your views are sometimes meant just for you. Reaching the top of Ambuluwawa, I saw a breathtaking 360-degree view of nature, mountains, clouds, and the peaceful surroundings. It felt like standing between the earth and sky. The wind, the silence, and the beauty touched my heart. It‚Äôs not just a tower ‚Äì it‚Äôs a symbol of life, growth, and solitude.

Check out photos and videos carefully cause this experience is not just to go on top of any tower or observatory. It‚Äôs tight and very tight and more tight as long as you go up. I had no space for my foot . The feeling is that to raise the sky. Please consider before going. I would not recommend for kids.

This complex probably generated jobs for a fair number of people but the building is pointless and an eyesore in my opinion and I dare not think of the impact on the environment. I wouldn't make a special trip to climb the tower. Only did so while staying at W15. The only good thing is that the view is pretty fantastic. No denying that.
Very good place and lovely Nature view and relaxing area. We are watching All Gampola area it‚Äôs so nice .. and restaurants good service..
Nice place, the top of the tower is a little scary though. Keep in mind the ticket window closes at 5pm and its at the bottom of the hill, good 10 mims away from the actual tower

column6: kandy tuk tuk tours by munasingha
column11: The tower features an unusual spiral design, with a structure that twists as it ascends. This design gives it a futuristic appearance and makes it a prominent landmark in the area. The combination of modern and traditional architectural elements makes it visually interesting

Ambuluwawa Tower is a great place to visit if you love nature and adventure. Climbing the tower is exciting, with winding stairs that make it feel like a fun challenge. When you reach the top, the views are amazing‚Äîyou can see hills, forests, and valleys all around. The tower is beautiful and stands out in the middle of nature. It's a peaceful place, and the adventure of climbing makes it even more special. If you're looking for a place with stunning views and a bit of excitement, Ambuluwawa Tower is perfect.

I went with my family and a friend. We drove on a rustic Mitsubishi jeep. That was truly a ride to remember and enjoy! A hike, walk to Ambuluwawa Rock near Kandy is an exhilarating experience that combines natural beauty with a touch of adventure. Located about 25 kilometers from Kandy, Ambuluwawa is known for its unique biodiversity complex and the iconic Ambuluwawa Tower. The hike begins at the base of the Ambuluwawa Mountain, where you‚Äôll start ascending through lush greenery and diverse plant life. The trail is moderately challenging, with a mix of steep sections and gentler slopes. As you climb higher, you‚Äôll be rewarded with stunning panoramic views of the surrounding mountains, forests, and rivers. At the summit, the Ambuluwawa Tower stands tall, offering a 360-degree view of the landscape which is breathtaking. The tower itself is a marvel, with a spiral staircase that narrows as you ascend, adding a bit of thrill to the climb. The top of the tower provides breathtaking views, making it a perfect spot for photography and simply soaking in the beauty of Sri Lanka. The entire hike, including the climb to the top of the tower, can take around 2-3 hours, depending on your pace. It‚Äôs advisable to start early in the morning to avoid the midday heat and to enjoy the serene atmosphere before the crowds arrive.

Tower is so good and amazing the only problems are the tuk tuk in the park in front of the office , I will definitely call them cheaters , what make me upset is they are the only few people  because everybody in Sri Lanka are so nice and honesty but of course there are always the exception .... For the rest nice tower and amazing country ‚ù§Ô∏è mama lassani Sri  Lanka

This place has great potential and amazing views! However, it gets crowded due to the number of rude tourists who push and shove. We were lucky to arrive during the rain, so there were fewer people, and as the rain stopped, the view was incredible. Unfortunately, more people arrived quickly, and we couldn't climb further. We only managed a few levels before descending. I recommend this place, but something needs to be done to regulate the number of tourists, perhaps by raising the price ;). -1 star for the large crowds and not being able to reach the top.

Only two of us out of our party of nine felt comfortable enough to climb the tower. We caught a tuk tuk at the bottom of the hill and the driver told us he would give us an hour and pick us back up at the base of the tower. It is a steep climb if you fancy walking up the hill, there were times when I thought our vehicle wouldn't make it. The climb of the tower starts inside and it is only when you are a third of the way up do you go outside. As you gradually make your way up the steps become narrower and the room to pass becomes more difficult, there are several little cubbyholes to assist with passing. The views from the top are extraordinary and well worth the effort. Exit is via the shop which has a good selection of gifts. There is also a small cafe, bungee swing and toilets (small charge). Our tuk tuk driver was waiting for us and the drive back down.

column7: Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
column11: This is must stop enroute Kandy to Nuwara Eliya. Mind it there is no lifts here so you need to be spot to get to the top. We went to the viewing platform halfway. The views from there were spectacular and breath taking. Just outside is the photo spot with a massive swing overlooking the valley. Sure Instagram photo spot.

Key is to get there the earliest  on morn before the clouds, haze and glare begins.Orthe late evening when the clouds get less.  Value is  that this tower gives a superb 360 view unimpeded  for at least 20km in every direction .

I am video Blogger (@Just SundaR) Last week I had visited this place it‚Äôs so amazing and it provides the Goosebump moment I recommend this place if you ready to climb the steps and it‚Äôs with visiting. from Kandy I take help from MR.Rizad (he‚Äôs own the tuk tuk) and he provided best rate to visit near by places I will add his contact details if you need you can check it out he‚Äôs trust worthy guy he know some interesting places as well.

Ambuluwawa Tower is located in the suburbs of Gampola Town in Sri Lanka. There has been an increased popularity in recent times especially due to the breathtaking views you can experience when you climb to the top of the Ambuluwawa Tower. It is also known for its narrow spiral staircase which some visitors find challenging to climb. It is one of the coolest places to visit in Sri Lanka if you are up for the challenge. Ambuluwawa Mountain Ambuluwawa mountain peak has a height of 3567 feet above sea level. It is located over 1000 feet above from the Gampola Town. The tower is located on the summit of the mountain peak. Since there are no other mountains in the surrounding area and due to its unique location, Ambuluwawa Tower gets an undisturbed view from far away and vice versa. The tower is visible from Gampola Train Station. The 48 meters tall, cone-shaped tower houses the Stupa (Pagoda) of the Buddhist Temple. As you climb up, it has several viewing platforms for you to enjoy the stunning views. The staircase gets narrower as you go up. The spiral staircase will be a challenging one to climb if you are not comfortable with heights. Ambuluwawa Biodiversity Complex is the first of its kind in Sri Lanka. It was opened in 2009. It is home to a variety of plants. It is considered as the fourth botanical garden in Sri Lanka. It is a multi-religious centre where followers of all faiths practiced in Sri Lanka come to practice their religion. It consists of a Buddhist Temple, Hindu Temple, a Church, and a Mosque. Nearest Town: Gampola You can travel by train to visit Ambuluwawa Tower. Gampola is the nearest train station. It is advisable to hire a tuk-tuk/taxi from Gampola if you are getting there by public transport. Gates open at 8.30 am. The distance from the entrance to the mountain peak is about 2.5 -3 km. You can take your car, hire a TUK TUK or walk to the top.

column7: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
column11: Here are two prices for visiting tourists - 2000rs for foreigners and a fraction of the cost for locals. In my opinion, this is ridiculous and can negatively impact the tourism industry. Treating foreigners solely as a source of income rather than with respect can discourage them from coming back to the country. Although you might read it is only 55 steps is a lie! The view requires a steep climb and many stairs, but I have never been to the top. I am afraid of heights and also feel uneasy about the construction quality of the place. The souvenir shop sells handmade goods at an overpriced rate, which discourages many people from buying. It's worth noting that the "foreigner toilets" - as they are named - are just two ordinary toilets. However, they are not easy to access. The "Local toilets" are located downstairs and are squat pans.

Beautiful tour but I, who am afraid of heights, was a little scared!!!! when arriving at the top after the end of the stairs of the 1st part because only 1 person passes on the staircase which narrows as we go up, small holes are made in order to get going and let people get on or off pass - I never looked down but I knew how to go there all the same

We weren‚Äôt originally planning to visit this but so glad we did. The views are incredible and if you dare go right to the top you can‚Äôt believe how high you are. There‚Äôs also a great cafe with views!
It is good tower for climb.there is beautiful scenery arround the whole environment very beautiful.enjoy the experience which must be cross

The Tower climb itself was exciting and risky, which was good. The disappointment was the litter and general dirt inside the Tower. A collection of litter and a mop out would greatly improve the experience.

The view is incredible, and the roads up to the tower are so lovely to ride a bike on, however the tower complex itself is woefully unkept. I am sad to say, but like many places in Sri Lanka this complex has no special spiritual feeling or atmosphere and is not well looked after. More effort has been made on the gift shop at the bottom of the tower than anything else from what I could tell. Don't believe all the hype on Instagram. Instagram always makes everything look amazing. As I said, the view is incredible, but the tower is dirty and there is rubbish all in the interior. I would not recommend this as a 'must see' place. I think there are spots in Ella where the view is equally beautiful. Disapointed.
A must visit when you are in Sri Lanka. The wind and  the sun  as we are approaching the top was out of this world experinces. There is a cafe at the bottom that serves decent coffee and cakes.
A deferent structure and creative design! I like it. It was very windy and could be dangerous for any body has afraid from heights.

Don't go if you're on the large side. - you will never be able to pass people on the stairs near the top - barely space for one person to get up let alone for another to be on his/her way down with only a small handrail between you and oblivion! On the up side, I really enjoyed this!!

A very beautiful and colorful place. The tower itself stands on a mountain, which is why it is so high. Climbing a mountain is a different story with adrenaline. We rented a car with a high-torque engine and therefore got in without any problems. The view from the tower itself is beautiful. I recommend visiting.

Gives you a good 360 view on a clear day. Beware, it does get busy, and towards the top narrow, someone has to give from coming down or going up. I'd recommend hiring a tuk tuk from Kandy all day so they take you wait at the top, back with some optional stops tea factory, botanical garden, and spice garden.

Nothing. Don't waste your time and money on this tower or kandi. The tower does not carry any architectural, historical or semantic meaning, just another fundraiser. Going up with a tuk-tuk, the whole area stinks of urine. 3 points for the view - but if you have been to other mountains, then there is no point in going there at all

Great situation, the hills from the base of the tower are wonderful. Climbing it be prepared to negotiate an ever narrowing staircase with a concrete balustrade handrail with a few uprights missing here and there and some gaps in the treads clearly showing the fall to certain death below. Its not well maintained to be frank. The steps are so narrow at the top its impossible to pass meaning people constantly have to go back but even that is very difficult indeed. I'm not bad with heights but didnt really like it having people trying to get past and the view downwards is dizzying. Nice coffee bar and clean toilets at the bottom.
You have to see it to believe!! The climb is thrilling but the views from top of the tower are absolutely breathtaking!ü§©
A good place with a view of the surrounding area. We got there first by car, then along the serpentine road in a tuk-tuk. We didn‚Äôt go to the tower itself; the panoramic area around was enough.

A very beautiful tower with a beautiful road to it. You can get to the tower from the lower parking lot by tuktuk (5 minutes). I don't recommend walking. It will take about 40 minutes uphill along the serpentine road. And then the same way down. The tower itself is beautiful. The steps at the very top are already 30-40 centimeters wide. It is very difficult to break up (thin). Apparently you won‚Äôt get all the way to the top, but 2/3 can be overcome. The views from the middle are amazing. I recommend it to everyone.

Not a safe set up. It was actually very scary and not in a good way. It would have been a Great place to visit if it were  managed  or developed a little better. The steps towards the top of the tower are so narrow that it‚Äôs impossible for two people to stand side by side at the same time. Even a single person can‚Äôt stand straight near the top of the tower. People have to squeeze past each other when walking up or down in opposite directions. At various instances some people simply has to fling their legs over the safety railing to allow opposite traffic to move past. Someone had to crouch down to the floor to let someone else jump over to cross into the opposite direction. The steps have been developed in a very narrow fashion and either the management needs to widen the steps or form groups that  move up at a particular time and only let the next group go up when the one before has returned. Sadly there is no supervision or any remote sense of management responsibility. We went up on Christmas-25th December and I agree that there would have been heavier than usual footfall due to the holiday but that‚Äôs no excuse to put safety of visitors at risk. Yes, the view from the top is great but reaching the top was extremely uncomfortable
Very unique experience climbing this tower! view is beautiful. Since the stairs are narrow, need patience and co-operation from travelers to safely go up and down. worth a visit

Ambuluwawa Temple is truly a unique destination, offering breathtaking views from its distinctive tower. However, visitors should be cautious. The climb to the top can be quite dangerous due to low railings, narrow staircases, and overcrowding. Additionally, starting from January 1st, the entry fee for tourists will double to 2000 LKR, which is worth considering when planning a visit. While the views are spectacular, safety and cost factors might be a concern for some visitors.
